intro: Tropaeolum bogotense, commonly known as the Andean nasturtium, is a herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Tropaeolaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, edible flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and culinary uses in various cultures.
